reviewText:
Based on the popular musical by Phyllida Lloyd and Catherine Johnson, "Mamma Mia!" is a jukebox musical told using songs by popular 1970s group ABBA. Unlike the original musical, this film is a more condensed truncated version of the story, several musical numbers were omitted. The cast consists of Meryl Streep, Amanda Seyfried, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgrd, Christine Baranski and Julie Walters. Donna Sheridan (Streep) is a single working mother running a hotel on a Greek island known as Kalokairi. With the help of her old Dynamo colleagues (Baranski, Walters) she plans to have a beautiful wedding for her daughter, Sophie (Seyfried) Unaware that Sophie has learned that Donna kept a diary that details romances with three men (Brosnan, Skarsgrd & Firth) Curious to know who her father is Sophie invites all three to her wedding. Surprised but also panicking Donna worries about the wedding, until her old colleagues cheer her up. To add more stress to the situation Donna learns Sam still has feelings for her, despite the fact that he had broken her heart in the past.

With songs like "Honey, Honey", "Dancing Queen", "Super Trouper" and "Voulez-Vous" this musical will have you singing and dancing all night long. Dig it the dancing queen.

9/10
It was given as a gift.  I am sure that they were happy with it.
